subject: Data
title: The Replication Crisis: When Big Data Lies
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Replication Crisis: When Big Data Lies.

hook.text: A 2015 study tried to replicate 100 published psychology findings. Only 36 held up.

buildup.text: Bigger datasets create more chances to find spurious correlations that look real but aren't.

discovery.text: With enough data, you can always find a 'statistically significant' pattern â€” even in random noise.

twist.text: Publish-or-perish pressure incentivizes researchers to mine data until something looks significant.

climax.text: The replication crisis showed that more data without better methods can produce worse science.

punchline.text: Big data can find patterns that don't actually exist.

quiz.question: What did the 2015 replication study reveal about psychology research?
